titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Pucketos Garden Club Records, 1929-2014 AIS.2014.02
titlestmt.author: Katelyn Quirin.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-07-08 17:25:30 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: This collection is comprised of materials from the Pucketos Garden Club of New Kensington, Pa.. It contains manuscript materials, photographs, and scrapbooks documenting the activities of the club.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into seven series ranging from the 1930s to 2014. Additional information about each series is included in the scope and content notes within each series.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Katelyn Quirin in 2015.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Pucketos Garden Club Records contains primarily materials created by the garden club between the 1930s and 2000s. It contains seven series including flower show materials, awards, newspaper clippings, committee meeting minutes, club communications, yearbooks, and material related to People Against Litter, an environmentalist group created by the Pucketos. In addition, the collection contains photographs, albums, and yearbooks.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Pucketos Garden Club Records, 1929-2014, AIS.2014.02, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Pucketos Garden Club Records, 1929-2014, AIS.2014.02, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Pucketos (Poe-key-tos) Garden Club was created in 1933 in New Kensington, Pa., at the suggestion of T.H. Hurt, the president of a men's garden club that was disbanding. Forty women attended the first meeting on September 14, 1933 and elected Mrs. H. Burns Smith as the first president. The club adopted its bylaws and constitution on October 2, 1933. Membership ranged from 80 women to around 60 today.

The name "Pucketos" developed as a tribute to their local history. It comes from Puckety Creek, which enters the Allegheny River, and the Pucketa Indian Trial, which runs from Export, Pa., to present day New Kensington. The activities of the club are outlined in their constitution: "to encourage the planting of gardens, to study methods of plant cultivation, to stimulate interest in cooperative gardening, to aid in the protection of wild flowers and birds, to cooperate in neighborhood betterment." Specifically, the club members participated in field trips to different gardens around Pittsburgh and the surrounding area, flower shows presented by the Pucketos and other local garden clubs, state competitions, and planting projects throughout the New Kensington area.

During the second half of the twentieth century, the club placed an increase focus on environmental protection. In 1986, Ruth Barkley, the club's Litter Awareness Chair, created the People Against Litter program that was active through the 1990s. The focus on environmentalism continues today as multiple committees report on environmental concerns.
The Pucketos documented their activities primarily through scrapbooks of photographs and newspaper clippings, as well as yearbooks and administrative papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains flower show materials from both the Pucketos Garden Club and other garden clubs from the Pittsburgh area. Arranged alphabetically by garden club, with miscellaneous materials at the end.

did.unittitle: Ayr Hill, Bear Creek Fork, Stonewall, and Manor Garden Clubs
Oakmont, Dark Hollow, Spade and Trowel, and Men's Garden Clubs
Pucketos Garden Club, Flower Show Floorplan

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series II contains award applications and awards given to the Pucketos Garden Club for a variety of competitions and special recognition, spanning the length of the club's existence.

did.unittitle: Dr. Glen Long for prize roses
Garden Club Federation of Pennsylvania, Award Rules and Applications
National Council of Garden Clubs, Mrs. Stewart re: award application
National Council of Garden Clubs, Flower Show Achievement Award [framed ribbon]
National Council of State Garden Clubs, Inc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series includes minutes for three club committees, meeting programs and fliers, and event fliers. Arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Subseries I contains meeting minutes for three Pucketos Garden Club Committees: the Twenty-fifth Anniversary Committee, Executive Board, and General Membership Meeting. Arranged by committee and chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains general meeting notices, miscellaneous meeting information, and newspaper clippings regarding Club meetings. It is arranged by subject and chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Subseries III contains promotional material and newspaper articles regarding Pucketos Garden Club events. It is arranged chronologically and by document type.

did.unittitle: Civic Dept. Conservation Garden Therapy Youth Activities Bookmarks

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: People Against Litter was an environmental organization created by the Pucketos Garden Club in the 1980s. This series includes newspaper and magazine articles, environmental materials, and a scrapbook.

did.unittitle: Newspaper Clippings, Pittsburgh Trash and Recycling

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series includes miscellaneous documents, such as correspondence, garden materials, and Pucketos historical documents. Arranged by relation to the Pucketos Garden Club and then chronologically.

did.unittitle: "The Heart of Your Community" Radio Broadcast Transcripts
"Good and Bad News from the Birdworld" Article
Garden Club Federation of Pennyslvania, Keystone Gardener
Garden Club Federation of Pennyslvania, Membership Materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series includes the Pucketos Garden Club's yearbooks from 1937-2012. Arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series is comprised of approximately 10 scrapbooks complied by various members of the club, with dates ranging from the 1930s-2000s. Some are in folders and some are wrapped. Arranged by location and chronologically.

did.unittitle: Scrapbook complied by Edna Mae Kreistlite

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains loose photographs spanning from the 1950s-2010s and 10 photograph albums. The images are of Pucketos events, gardens, and members. The series is arranged chronologically and by location.

did.unittitle: Arbor Day Tree Planting in Memorial Park
Longwood and Winterthur Field Trip Albums
Group Photograph at Penn State New Kensington Nature Trail
